isis.stitle: PRE-DELIVERY/QUALITY INSPECTION INSTRUCTION MANUAL FOR 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400 MODELS - 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400 Model INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS (REPORT S00021) - ROAD TEST

svcproc.title: ROAD TEST
svcproc.para: 33. Engine ECM and Truck ESC, clear inactive fault codes.

item.para: To clear International engine ECM fault codes, turn key switch to ON, depress cruise control ON and SET switches simultaneously for 3 seconds, then pump accelerator pedal 3 times. Refer to the applicable Service or Owners Manual for additional information.

To clear truck ESC fault codes, turn the key switch to ACC, apply left turn signal, and hold the cruise control ON and SET switches simultaneously for 3 seconds. Refer to the applicable Service or Owners Manual for additional information.

svcproc.para: 34. Service brakes, clutch, steering, and accelerator systems.

item.para: Verify operation of brakes. Be aware of unusual sounds, pulling or darting.

Verify that clutch releases and engages smoothly without slipping. Insure that free play and clutch brake adjustments (if equipped) are within specifications. Refer to the Service Manual section for clutch listed on line set ticket for proper specification.
Steering system performance. Be aware of unusual sounds, excessive wheel play, pulling or darting sideways. Operate tilt/telescoping column if equipped, WHILE VEHICLE IS STOPPED.
Verify operation of accelerator. Check freedom of movement and full throttle travel. There should be no interference with other components.
Verify operation of speedometer and tachometer.
Verify operation of heater/defroster/air conditioning and ventilation in all modes. System should operate as outlined in the Owners Manual.
Overall engine performance. Note any unsatisfactory performance such as hard starting, rough idle, stumble or hesitation during acceleration, or poor acceleration, unusual noises or excessive smoke.
Verify that all gears/speeds are identified correctly on decal or selector.
Verify that transmission shifts correctly in all gears.
Verify that two speed axle shifts per Owners Manual instructions.

warning.para: Never attempt to shift a two-speed axle when descending a hill as it could cause a loss of vehicle control and result in an accident.

caution.para: When auxiliary transmissions are used in combination with automatic transmissions, a loaded vehicle should not be started with the auxiliary in the OD (overdrive) position.

item.para: Verify park brake operation, apply park brake, start engine and place transmission in low gear. Verify that brake holds when attempting to move the vehicle without use of the accelerator.

warning.para: Make sure nothing is in the path of the vehicle when performing this operation. Property damage or personal injury could result.
